without warning. Its sharp fangs

at the side of a river. However, this Pokémon often forgets

at water’s edge.

seconds for it to feel pain when under
attack.

even notice for a whole day.

It floats while emitting powerful
electromagnetic waves.

The units at the

ends up on the ground. If you give batteries to a
grounded Magnemite, it’ll start moving again.

MAGNEMITE floats in the air by emitting

at its sides. These waves block gravity. This POKéMON becomes incapable of
flight if its internal electrical supply

name: haunter
flavor_text:
Haunter is a dangerous Pokémon. If one beckons you while
floating in darkness, you must never approach it. This Pokémon
will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.

Its tongue is made
of gas. If licked,
its victim starts shaking constantly
until death even­
tually comes.

This frightful, malevolent spirit can glide through walls,
appearing wherever it likes. According to rumor, victims of
a Haunter's lick will wither to death day by day.

It licks with its gaseous tongue
to steal the victim’s life force.
It lurks in darkness for prey.

In total darkness, where nothing is

stalking its next victim.

On moonless nights, Haunter searches for
someone to curse, so it’s best not to go out
walking around.

It can slip through any obstacle.

close by.

name: porygon

created Pokémon. It can travel
through electronic space.

data and entering cyberspace. This Pokémon is copy protected
so it cannot be duplicated by copying.

It was built 20 years ago by scientists who
dreamed of exploring space. Their dreams have
yet to come true.

It is a manmade
POKéMON. Since it
doesn't breathe, people are eager
to try it in any
environment.

The only Pokémon that people anticipate
can fly into space. None has managed
the feat yet, however.

utilizing the latest technology of the time.

a result of research. It is programmed
with only basic motions.

name: vanillite
flavor_text:
Supposedly, this Pokémon was born from an
icicle. It spews out freezing air at −58 degrees
Fahrenheit to make itself more comfortable.

The temperature of their breath is -58 degrees
Fahrenheit. They create snow crystals and make
snow fall in the areas around them.

It exhales cold air that is at –58 degrees
Fahrenheit. When it’s in a warm place, it shrinks
little by little.

This Pokémon formed from icicles
bathed in energy from the morning sun.
It sleeps buried in snow.

Born of an icicle, this Pokémon uses its frosty
breath to make ice crystals, causing snow
to fall.

Unable to survive in hot areas, it makes itself
comfortable by breathing out air cold enough to
cause snow. It burrows into the snow to sleep.

This Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy
from the morning sun. It sleeps buried in snow.

It feels pleasantly cool when embraced. This
Pokémon is treasured by households in
warm regions.

When the morning sun hit an icicle, it wished not
to melt, and thus Vanillite was born. At night, it
buries itself in snow to sleep.

icicles bathed in energy from the morning
sun. Their breath is -58° F.

is -58° F. They create snow crystals and

name: vanillish
flavor_text:
This hearty Pokémon survived the Ice Age.
It’s incredibly popular in very hot regions.

They cool down the surrounding air and create ice
particles, which they use to freeze their foes.

Snowy mountains are this Pokémon’s habitat.
During an ancient ice age, they moved to
southern areas.

Hot days cause its body to melt. It can be
restored by refreezing it, but the process
leaves its body slightly warped.

It blasts enemies with cold air reaching −148
degrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it
spares their lives afterward—it’s a kind Pokémon.

It conceals itself from enemy eyes
by creating many small ice particles
and hiding among them.

This Pokémon has existed since the Ice Age. It
controls particles of ice, freezes its opponents,
and then shatters them with a headbutt.

They cool down the surrounding air
and create ice particles, which
they use to freeze their foes.

By drinking pure water, it grows its icy body.
This Pokémon can be hard to find on days with
warm, sunny weather.

Snowy mountains are this Pokémon’s
habitat. During an ancient ice age, they
moved to southern areas.

It sprays its enemies with grains of ice to freeze
them. Most Vanillish in Alola are smaller
than average.

name: vanilluxe
flavor_text:
Even if it loses one of its heads, it can live
relatively problem-free. It makes snow clouds
inside its body.

People believe this Pokémon formed when two
Vanillish stuck together. Its body temperature is
roughly 21 degrees Fahrenheit.

Each of its two heads has a brain, and when
they are in agreement, it attacks its enemies
by exhaling a violent blizzard.

It blasts blizzards from its two mouths. It can
create snow anywhere, so it gets a lot of love
from skiers and snowboarders.

Swallowing large amounts of water, they make
snow clouds inside their bodies and, when angry,
cause violent blizzards.

When its anger reaches a breaking point, this
Pokémon unleashes a fierce blizzard that freezes
every creature around it, be they friend or foe.

make snow clouds inside their bodies and,
when angry, cause violent blizzards.

If both heads get angry simultaneously,
this Pokémon expels a blizzard, burying
everything in snow.

make snow clouds inside their bodies and
attack their foes with violent blizzards.

If both heads get angry simultaneously, this
Pokémon expels a blizzard, burying everything

could fire energy beams.

It flies across the sky at Mach speeds.

its internal energy go out of control.

cellular structure.

This legendary ice Pokémon waits for
a hero to fill in the missing parts
of its body with truth or ideals.

Dwelling within it is a power even greater than
that of Reshiram or Zekrom, but the extreme
cold keeps that power bound.

It generates a powerful, freezing
energy inside itself, but its body became
frozen when the energy leaked out.

It can produce ultracold air.
Its body is frozen.

This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill
in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.

name: keldeo-ordinary
flavor_text:
When it is resolute, its body fills
with power and it becomes swifter.
Its jumps are then too fast to follow.

They say that Keldeo must survive harsh battles
and fully develop the horn on its forehead
before this Pokémon’s true power will awaken.

By blasting water from its hooves, it can
glide across water. It excels at using
leg moves while battling.

It crosses the world, running over
the surfaces of oceans and rivers.
It appears at scenic waterfronts.

Cobalion, Terrakion, and Virizion taught this
Pokémon how to fight. It dashes across the world,
seeking more opportunities to further its training.

It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of
oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.

When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it
becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast
to follow.

flavor_text:
Many famous songs have been inspired
by the melodies that Meloetta plays.

Its melodies are sung with a special
vocalization method that can control
the feelings of those who hear it.

Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization
method that can control the feelings of those who
hear it.

The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to
make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad.

The melodies sung by Meloetta have

hear them happy or sad.

This ancient bug Pokémon was altered

This ancient bug Pokémon was altered by Team

This Pokémon existed 300 million years

attached a cannon to its back.

This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team

as the strongest of hunters.
It has been modified by Team Plasma.

As it walks, it munches on a twig in place

by puffing hot air out of its ears.

flavor_text:
It has ears like shovels. Digging holes
strengthens its ears so much that they
can sever thick roots effortlessly.

They use their large ears to dig burrows.
They will dig the whole night through.

It’s very sensitive to danger. The sound of
Corviknight’s flapping will have Bunnelby
digging a hole to hide underground in moments.

It excels at digging holes. Using its ears, it can
dig a nest 33 feet deep in one night.

from fur shed by this Pokémon.

As powerful as an excavator, its ears
can reduce dense bedrock to rubble.
When it’s finished digging, it lounges lazily.

With their powerful ears, they can heft
boulders of a ton or more with ease.
They can be a big help at construction sites.

With power equal to an excavator, it can dig
through dense bedrock. It’s a huge help during
tunnel construction.

name: fletchling
flavor_text:
These friendly Pokémon send signals
to one another with beautiful chirps
and tail-feather movements.

Its melodious cries are actually warnings.
Fletchling will mercilessly peck at anything
that enters its territory.

Despite the beauty of its lilting voice, it’s
merciless to intruders that enter its territory.

Its body is always warm. Trainers who live in
cold areas apparently sleep with it in their bed.

When it’s excited, its temperature can double,
spiking hormone production in its body.

While it’s an amiable Pokémon, if you touch it
unexpectedly, it will heat up its body in an
instant, and you’ll be burned.

When this Pokémon gets excited, its body
temperature increases sharply. If you touch a
Fletchling with bare hands, you might get burned.

This amiable Pokémon is easy to train.
But when battle is joined, it shows its
ferocious side.

name: fletchinder
flavor_text:
The hotter the flame sac on its belly,
the faster it can fly, but it takes some
time to get the fire going.

Its speed right after takeoff already puts it in
the top speed class of all bird Pokémon.

From its beak, it expels embers that set
the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on
the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.

From its beak, it fires embers at its prey. Once
it has caught them, it grills them at high heat
before feasting upon them.

It scatters embers in the tall grass. Then bug
Pokémon, frightened by the flames, come
flying out, and Fletchinder gobbles them up.

Fletchinder launches embers into the den of
its prey. When the prey comes leaping out,
Fletchinder’s sharp talons finish it off.

Fletchinder are exceedingly territorial and
aggressive. These Pokémon fight among
themselves over feeding grounds.

It will not tolerate other Fletchinder entering its
territory, which has a radius of several miles.

name: talonflame
flavor_text:
Bird Pokémon make up most of its diet.
It approaches at high speeds and smacks them
down to the ground with its powerful kick.

Talonflame mainly preys upon other bird
Pokémon. To intimidate opponents, it sends
embers spewing from gaps between its feathers.

Its favorite foods are Wingull and Pikipek.
It attacks with a powerful kick and grasps them
firmly in its talons.

Talonflame dives toward prey at speeds of up to
310 mph and assaults them with powerful kicks,
giving the prey no chance to escape.

When attacking prey, it can reach speeds
of up to 310 mph. It finishes its prey off
with a colossal kick.

In the fever of an exciting battle, it
showers embers from the gaps between
its feathers and takes to the air.

It zooms directly at its prey at flight speeds of
close to 310 mph, while fiery embers scatter
from gaps in its feathers.

Its tough wings don’t allow fire to pass through
them. A long time ago, firefighters’ outfits were
made from Talonflame wings.

name: litleo
flavor_text:
When they’re young, they live with a pride. Once
they’re able to hunt prey on their own, they’re
kicked out and have to make their own way.

This hot-blooded Pokémon is filled with
curiosity. When it gets angry or starts
fighting, its short mane gets hot.

The stronger the opponent it faces,
the more heat surges from its mane
and the more power flows through its body.

They set off on their own from their pride
and live by themselves to become stronger.
These hot-blooded Pokémon are quick to fight.

The females protect the pride’s cubs.

The temperature of its breath is over 10,000

The males are usually lazy, but when attacked
by a strong foe, a male will protect its friends
with no regard for its own safety.

name: flabebe
flavor_text:
It draws out and controls the hidden power
of flowers. The flower Flabébé holds
is most likely part of its body.

Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it’s
collected from its flower. The crown has hidden
healing properties.

When it finds a flower it likes, it dwells on
that flower its whole life long. It floats in the
wind’s embrace with an untroubled heart.

It’s not safe without the power of a flower, but
it will keep traveling around until it finds one
with the color and shape it wants.

It gives its own power to flowers, pouring its
heart into caring for them. Floette never forgives
anyone who messes up a flower bed.

When the flowers of a well-tended flower bed bloom,
it appears and celebrates with an elegant dance.

It raises flowers and uses them as weapons.
The more gorgeous the blossom, the more
power it contains.

Its life can span several hundred years. It’s said
to devote its entire life to protecting gardens.

It controls the flowers it grows. The petal
blizzards that Florges triggers are overwhelming
in their beauty and power.

harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.

If it has sunshine and water, it doesn’t
need to eat, because it can generate
energy from the leaves on its back.

It can tell how its Trainer is feeling by
subtle shifts in the grip on its horns.
This empathic sense lets them run as if one being.

name: pancham
flavor_text:
Wanting to make sure it’s taken seriously,
Pancham’s always giving others a glare.
But if it’s not focusing, it ends up smiling.

It’s desperate to intimidate its opponents.
Be nice and pretend to be scared if you
catch it glaring at you intensely.

It does its best to be taken seriously by its enemies,
but its glare is not sufficiently intimidating.
Chewing on a leaf is its trademark.

It follows Pangoro around like a henchman.
When Pancham makes a big mistake, its leaf
gets taken away.

It does its level best to glare and pull a scary face,
but it can’t help grinning if anyone pats its head.

It chooses a Pangoro as its master and then
imitates its master’s actions. This is how it learns
to battle and hunt for prey.

It grows up imitating the behavior of Pangoro,
which it looks up to as a leader.

name: pangoro
flavor_text:
This rowdy Pokémon boasts great physical
strength. Many Trainers are also smitten by its
lively character.

It charges ahead and bashes its opponents like
a berserker, uncaring about any hits it might take.
Its arms are mighty enough to snap a telephone pole.

Although it possesses a violent temperament,
it won’t put up with bullying. It uses the leaf in
its mouth to sense the movements of its enemies.

Pangoro is the type to talk with its fists. It
doesn’t say much as it pummels opponents with
enough force to send a dump truck flying.

It boasts superb physical strength. Those who
wish to become Pangoro’s Trainer have no
choice but to converse with their fists.

From the slight twitches of its bamboo leaf, it
deduces its opponent’s movements. It’s eager to
tussle but kindhearted toward its companions.

Using its leaf, Pangoro can predict the moves of
its opponents. It strikes with punches that can
turn a dump truck into scrap with just one hit.

This Pokémon is quick to anger, and it has no
problem using its prodigious strength to get its
way. It lives for duels against Obstagoon.

name: furfrou
flavor_text:
There was an era when aristocrats would
compete to see who could trim their Furfrou’s
fur into the most exquisite style.

Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer,
but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

Trimming its fluffy fur not only makes
it more elegant but also increases the
swiftness of its movements.

Historically, in the Kalos region, these Pokémon
were the designated guardians of the king.

abilities.name: fur-coat

name: espurr
flavor_text:
It has enough psychic energy to blast
everything within 300 feet of itself,
but it has no control over its power.

There’s enough psychic power in Espurr to send a
wrestler flying, but because this power can’t be
controlled, Espurr finds it troublesome.

The organ that emits its intense psychic power is
sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.

Though Espurr’s expression never changes,
behind that blank stare is an intense struggle to
contain its devastating psychic power.

grind a 10-ton truck into dust.

The defensive instinct of the males is strong.
It’s when they’re protecting themselves or their
partners that they unleash their full power.

Revealing the eyelike patterns on the insides of
its ears will unleash its psychic powers. It normally
keeps the patterns hidden, however.

The eyeball patterns on the interior of its ears
emit psychic energy. It keeps the patterns tightly
covered because that power is too immense.

name: honedge
flavor_text:
Apparently this Pokémon is born when a
departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself
to people and drinks their life force.

If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps
a blue cloth around that person’s arm and
drains that person’s life energy completely.

Honedge’s soul once belonged to a person who
was killed a long time ago by the sword that
makes up Honedge’s body.

The blue eye on the sword’s handguard is the
true body of Honedge. With its old cloth, it
drains people’s lives away.

The complex attack patterns of its two swords
are unstoppable, even for an opponent
greatly accomplished at swordplay.

When Honedge evolves, it divides into two swords,
which cooperate via telepathy to coordinate attacks
and slash their enemies to ribbons.

The two swords employ a strategy of rapidly
alternating between offense and defense to
bring down their prey.

Honedge evolves into twins. The two blades
rub together to emit a metallic sound that
unnerves opponents.

name: aegislash-shield
flavor_text:
Apparently, it can detect the innate qualities
of leadership. According to legend, whoever it
recognizes is destined to become king.

In this defensive stance, Aegislash uses its steel
body and a force field of spectral power to
reduce the damage of any attack.

Generations of kings were attended by these
Pokémon, which used their spectral power to
manipulate and control people and Pokémon.

Its potent spectral powers allow it to manipulate
others. It once used its powers to force people
and Pokémon to build a kingdom to its liking.

abilities.name: stance-change
abilities.short_effect: Changes aegislash to Blade Forme before using a damaging move, or Shield Forme before using kings shield.

evolution_chain_details: honedge to doublade: level-up at level 35
doublade to aegislash: use a dusk stone

name: spritzee
flavor_text:
In the past, rather than using perfume,
royal ladies carried a Spritzee
that would waft a fragrance they liked.

It emits a scent that enraptures those
who smell it. This fragrance changes
depending on what it has eaten.

A scent pouch within this Pokémon’s body allows
it to create various scents. A change in its diet
will alter the fragrance it produces.

The scent its body gives off enraptures those
who smell it. Noble ladies had no shortage of
love for Spritzee.

abilities.name: healer
abilities.short_effect: Has a 30% chance of curing each adjacent ally of any major status ailment after each turn.

abilities.name: aroma-veil
abilities.short_effect: Protects allies against moves that affect their mental state.

evolution_chain_details: spritzee to aromatisse: trade while holding sachet

name: aromatisse
flavor_text:
The scents Aromatisse can produce range from
sweet smells that bolster allies to foul smells
that sap an opponent’s will to fight.

The scent that constantly emits from its fur is so
powerful that this Pokémon’s companions will
eventually lose their sense of smell.

It devises various scents, pleasant and unpleasant,
and emits scents that its enemies dislike in order
to gain an edge in battle.

Its scent is so overpowering that, unless a Trainer
happens to really enjoy the smell, he or she will
have a hard time walking alongside it.

abilities.name: healer
abilities.short_effect: Has a 30% chance of curing each adjacent ally of any major status ailment after each turn.

abilities.name: aroma-veil
abilities.short_effect: Protects allies against moves that affect their mental state.

evolution_chain_details: spritzee to aromatisse: trade while holding sachet

name: swirlix
flavor_text:
It eats its own weight in sugar every day.
If it doesn’t get enough sugar, it becomes
incredibly grumpy.

To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes
white threads as sweet and sticky as cotton candy.

The sweet smell of cotton candy perfumes
Swirlix’s fluffy fur. This Pokémon spits out
sticky string to tangle up its enemies.

Because it eats nothing but sweets,
its fur is as sticky sweet as cotton candy.

abilities.name: sweet-veil
abilities.short_effect: Prevents friendly Pokémon from sleeping.

abilities.name: unburden
abilities.short_effect: Doubles Speed upon using or losing a held item.

evolution_chain_details: swirlix to slurpuff: trade while holding whipped dream

name: slurpuff
flavor_text:
Slurpuff’s fur contains a lot of air, making it soft
to the touch and lighter than it looks.

Its sense of smell is 100 million times better than
a human’s, so even the faintest scent tells it about
everything in the area. It’s like it can see with its nose!

It can distinguish the faintest of scents.
It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use
by helping pastry chefs in their work.

By taking in a person’s scent, it can sniff out their
mental and physical condition. It’s hoped that
this skill will have many medical applications.

abilities.name: sweet-veil
abilities.short_effect: Prevents friendly Pokémon from sleeping.

abilities.name: unburden
abilities.short_effect: Doubles Speed upon using or losing a held item.

evolution_chain_details: swirlix to slurpuff: trade while holding whipped dream

name: inkay
flavor_text:
It spins while making its luminescent spots flash.
These spots allow it to communicate with others
by using different patterns of light.

Opponents who stare at the flashing of the
light-emitting spots on its body become
dazed and lose their will to fight.

When exchanging information with others of its
kind, it flashes the light-emitting spots on its
body in a complex rhythm.

By exposing foes to the blinking of its
luminescent spots, Inkay demoralizes them,
and then it seizes the chance to flee.

It draws prey near with its blinking lights and
then wraps them up in its long tentacles and
holds them in place.

It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body,
which drains its opponent’s will to fight.
It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.

abilities.name: contrary
abilities.short_effect: Inverts stat changes.

abilities.name: suction-cups
abilities.short_effect: Prevents being forced out of battle by other Pokémon's moves.

abilities.name: infiltrator
abilities.short_effect: Bypasses light screen, reflect, and safeguard.

evolution_chain_details: inkay to malamar: level-up at level 30 while holding console upside down

name: malamar
flavor_text:
Gazing at its luminescent spots will quickly
induce a hypnotic state, putting the observer
under Malamar’s control.

It flashes the pattern on its torso to control its
prey and draw them in. The edges of its fins are
supremely sharp.

It’s said that Malamar’s hypnotic powers played
a role in certain history-changing events.

It lures its prey close with hypnotic motions,
then wraps its tentacles around it before
finishing it off with digestive fluids.

When it comes to strong hypnosis, there’s an
endless number of people who utilize Malamar
for their nefarious deeds.

It wields the most compelling hypnotic powers
of any Pokémon, and it forces others to do
whatever it wants.

abilities.name: contrary
abilities.short_effect: Inverts stat changes.

name: binacle
flavor_text:
They stretch and then contract, yanking their
rocks along with them in bold hops. They eat
seaweed that washes up on the shoreline.

Two Binacle live together on one rock.
When they fight, one of them will move
to a different rock.

If the two don’t work well together, both their
offense and defense fall apart. Without good
teamwork, they won’t survive.

After two Binacle find a suitably sized rock, they
adhere themselves to it and live together.
They cooperate to gather food during high tide.

abilities.name: tough-claws
abilities.short_effect: Strengthens moves that make contact to 1.33× their power.

abilities.name: sniper
abilities.short_effect: Strengthens critical hits to inflict 3× damage rather than 2×.

abilities.name: pickpocket
abilities.short_effect: Steals attacking Pokémon's held items on contact.

evolution_chain_details: binacle to barbaracle: level-up at level 39

name: barbaracle
flavor_text:
Having an eye on each palm allows it to keep
watch in all directions. In a pinch, its limbs start
to act on their own to ensure the enemy’s defeat.

Seven Binacle come together to form one
Barbaracle. The Binacle that serves as the head
gives orders to those serving as the limbs.

When they evolve, two Binacle multiply into seven.
They fight with the power of seven Binacle.

Barbaracle’s legs and hands have minds
of their own, and they will move independently.
But they usually follow the head’s orders.

abilities.name: tough-claws

name: skrelp
flavor_text:
It’s not good at swimming, so it clings to the
seaweed. In the Alola region, it’s often found
near Dhelmise.

It vanishes into seaweed and remains perfectly
still to avoid attacks from large Pokémon.
Rotten seaweed is its main food source.

It looks just like rotten kelp. It hides from foes
while storing up power for its evolution.

Skrelp looks like a piece of rotten seaweed, so it
can blend in with seaweed drifting on the ocean
and avoid being detected by enemies.

Camouflaged as rotten kelp, they spray
liquid poison on prey that approaches
unawares and then finish it off.

It drifts in the ocean, blending in with floating
seaweed. When other Pokémon come to feast on
the seaweed, Skrelp feasts on them instead.

abilities.name: poison-point
abilities.short_effect: Has a 30% chance of poisoning attacking Pokémon on contact.

abilities.name: poison-touch
abilities.short_effect: Has a 30% chance of poisoning target Pokémon upon contact.

abilities.name: adaptability
abilities.short_effect: Increases the same-type attack bonus from 1.5× to 2×.

evolution_chain_details: skrelp to dragalge: level-up at level 48

name: dragalge
flavor_text:
Their poison is strong enough to eat through
the hull of a tanker, and they spit it indiscriminately
at anything that enters their territory.

Dragalge uses a poisonous liquid capable of
corroding metal to send tankers that enter its
territory to the bottom of the sea.

It blends in with seaweed to ambush its prey
and then takes them down with a poisonous
liquid strong enough to melt metal.

This vicious Pokémon sprays a poisonous liquid
on opponents that come near. For whatever
reason, it gets along really well with Dhelmise.

Dragalge generates dragon energy by sticking
the plume on its head out above the ocean’s
surface and bathing it in sunlight.

Tales are told of ships that wander into
seas where Dragalge live, never to return.

abilities.name: poison-point
abilities.short_effect: Has a 30% chance of poisoning attacking Pokémon on contact.

name: clauncher
flavor_text:
Clauncher’s claws can fall off during battle, but
they’ll regenerate. The meat inside the claws is
popular as a delicacy in Galar.

It moves around by jetting water from its right
pincer. It has a poor sense of balance, so it’s
terrible at swimming straight.

Through controlled explosions of internal gas,
it can expel water like a pistol shot.
At close distances, it can shatter rock.

They knock down flying prey by firing
compressed water from their massive
claws like shooting a pistol.

Its claws occasionally fall off, and it keeps a low
profile until they grow back. The meat of its
claws is so delicious!

By detonating gas that accumulates in its right
claw, this Pokémon launches water like a bullet.
This is how Clauncher defeats its enemies.

abilities.name: mega-launcher
abilities.short_effect: Strengthens aura and pulse moves to 1.5× their power.

evolution_chain_details: clauncher to clawitzer: level-up at level 37

name: clawitzer
flavor_text:
Their enormous claws launch cannonballs of
water powerful enough to pierce tanker hulls.

By expelling water from the nozzle in the back
of its claw, it can move at a speed of 60 knots.

Clawitzer’s right arm is a cannon that launches
projectiles made of seawater. Shots from a
Clawitzer’s cannon arm can sink a tanker.

After using the feelers on its oversized claw to
detect the location of prey, Clawitzer launches
a cannonball of water at its target.

It compresses the water it has sucked up and
then projects it with enough power to punch a
hole right through a thick sheet of iron.

Its right arm is packed with meat. When its
pincer falls off, it’s exported to be used as a
cooking ingredient.

abilities.name: mega-launcher
abilities.short_effect: Strengthens aura and pulse moves to 1.5× their power.

evolution_chain_details: clauncher to clawitzer: level-up at level 37

name: helioptile
flavor_text:
The frills on either side of its head have cells
that generate electricity when exposed to sunlight.

They make their home in deserts. They can
generate their energy from basking in the sun,
so eating food is not a requirement.

When spread, the frills on its head act like solar
panels, generating the power behind this
Pokémon’s electric moves.

The sun powers this Pokémon’s electricity
generation. Interruption of that process
stresses Helioptile to the point of weakness.

abilities.name: dry-skin
abilities.short_effect: Causes 1/8 max HP in damage each turn during strong sunlight, but heals for 1/8 max HP during rain.  Increases damage from fire moves to 1.25×, but absorbs water moves, healing for 1/4 max HP.

abilities.name: sand-veil
abilities.short_effect: Increases evasion to 1.25× during a sandstorm.  Protects against sandstorm damage.

abilities.name: solar-power
abilities.short_effect: Increases Special Attack to 1.5× but costs 1/8 max HP after each turn during strong sunlight.

evolution_chain_details: helioptile to heliolisk: use a sun stone

name: heliolisk
flavor_text:
They flare their frills and generate energy.
A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient
electricity to power a skyscraper.

One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill
outspread is all it would take to produce enough
electricity to power a city.

It stimulates its muscles with electricity,
boosting the strength in its legs and enabling
it to run 100 yards in five seconds.

A now-vanished desert culture treasured these
Pokémon. Appropriately, when Heliolisk came to
the Galar region, treasure came with them.

abilities.name: dry-skin
abilities.short_effect: Causes 1/8 max HP in damage each turn during strong sunlight, but heals for 1/8 max HP during rain.  Increases damage from fire moves to 1.25×, but absorbs water moves, healing for 1/4 max HP.

name: tyrunt
flavor_text:
Tyrunt is spoiled and selfish. It may just be
trying to frolic, but sometimes the ones it’s
trying to frolic with are gravely injured.

Its large jaw has incredible destructive power.
Some theories suggest that its restored form is
different from its form of long ago.

This Pokémon is selfish and likes to be pampered.
It can also inflict grievous wounds on its Trainer
just by playing around.

This is an ancient Pokémon, revived in modern
times. It has a violent disposition, and it’ll tear
apart anything it gets between its hefty jaws.

Its immense jaws have enough destructive
force that it can chew up an automobile.
It lived 100 million years ago.

This Pokémon was restored from a fossil.
If something happens that it doesn’t like,
it throws a tantrum and runs wild.

abilities.name: strong-jaw
abilities.short_effect: Strengthens biting moves to 1.5× their power.

abilities.name: sturdy
abilities.short_effect: Prevents being KOed from full HP, leaving 1 HP instead.  Protects against the one-hit KO moves regardless of HP.

evolution_chain_details: tyrunt to tyrantrum: level-up at level 39 during day

name: tyrantrum
flavor_text:
A single bite of Tyrantrum’s massive jaws will
demolish a car. This Pokémon was the king of the
ancient world.

This Pokémon is from about 100,000,000
years ago. It has the presence of a king, vicious
but magnificent.

Complete restoration is impossible, allowing
room for theories that its entire body was
once covered in a feather-like coat.

The king of the ancient world, it can easily
crunch a car with the devastating strength
of its enormous jaws.

Nothing could stop this Pokémon
100 million years ago,
so it behaved like a king.

Thanks to its gargantuan jaws, which could shred
thick metal plates as if they were paper, it was
invincible in the ancient world it once inhabited.

abilities.name: strong-jaw
abilities.short_effect: Strengthens biting moves to 1.5× their power.

abilities.name: rock-head
abilities.short_effect: Protects against recoil damage.

evolution_chain_details: tyrunt to tyrantrum: level-up at level 39 during day

name: amaura
flavor_text:
This Pokémon was successfully restored from a
fossil. In the past, it lived with others of its kind
in cold lands where there were fewer predators.

Amaura is an ancient Pokémon that has gone
extinct. Specimens of this species can sometimes
be found frozen in ice.

Amaura was restored successfully, but it’s not
expected to live long because of the heat of the
current environment.

This ancient Pokémon was restored
from part of its body that had been
frozen in ice for over 100 million years.

It lived in cold areas in ancient times. It’s said
that when Amaura whinnies, auroras appear in
the night sky.

This calm Pokémon lived in a cold land where
there were no violent predators like Tyrantrum.

abilities.name: refrigerate
abilities.short_effect: Turns the bearer's normal moves into ice moves and strengthens them to 1.3× their power.

abilities.name: snow-warning
abilities.short_effect: Summons hail that lasts indefinitely upon entering battle.

evolution_chain_details: amaura to aurorus: level-up at level 39 during night

name: aurorus
flavor_text:
Aurorus was restored from a fossil. It’s said that
when this Pokémon howls, auroras appear in the
night sky.

Using its diamond-shaped crystals,
it can instantly create a wall of
ice to block an opponent’s attack.

When gripped by rage, Aurorus will emanate
freezing air, covering everything around it in ice.

An Aurorus was found frozen solid within a
glacier, just as it appeared long ago, which
became quite a big event in the news.

This usually quiet and kindly Pokémon has a
surface temperature of around
–240 degrees Fahrenheit.

The diamond-shaped crystals on its body
expel air as cold as -240 degrees Fahrenheit,
surrounding its enemies and encasing them in ice.

abilities.name: refrigerate
abilities.short_effect: Turns the bearer's normal moves into ice moves and strengthens them to 1.3× their power.

abilities.name: snow-warning
abilities.short_effect: Summons hail that lasts indefinitely upon entering battle.

name: sylveon
flavor_text:
It emits a soothing aura from its ribbon-shaped organs. It wraps
these appendages around quarrelers to instantly restore calm to
the situation.

By releasing enmity-erasing waves from its
ribbonlike feelers, Sylveon stops any conflict.

When this Pokémon sights its prey, it swirls its
ribbonlike feelers as a distraction. A moment
later, it pounces.

Its ribbonlike feelers give off an aura that
weakens hostility in its prey, causing them
to let down their guard. Then it attacks.

It sends a soothing aura from its
ribbonlike feelers to calm fights.

Sylveon wraps its ribbonlike feelers around its
Trainer’s arm because this touch enables it to
read its Trainer’s feelings.

Once a fight breaks out, it will unflinchingly
charge at dragon Pokémon that are many times
larger than itself.

It wraps its ribbonlike feelers around
the arm of its beloved Trainer
and walks with him or her.

There’s a Galarian fairy tale that describes
a beautiful Sylveon vanquishing a dreadful
dragon Pokémon.

abilities.name: cute-charm
abilities.short_effect: Has a 30% chance of infatuating attacking Pokémon on contact.

abilities.name: pixilate
abilities.short_effect: Turns the bearer's normal moves into fairy moves and strengthens them to 1.3× their power.

name: hawlucha
flavor_text:
In combat, Hawlucha leaps nimbly about, taking
advantage of its opponents’ blind spots. It’s
also skilled at using superb submission holds.

It drives its opponents to exhaustion with its agile
maneuvers, then ends the fight with a flashy
finishing move.

It overwhelms opponents with quick moves, but
sometimes it showboats for too long when it’s
using a special move and gets itself into a pinch.

It always strikes a pose before going for its
finishing move. Sometimes opponents take
advantage of that time to counterattack.

With its wings, it controls its position in the air.
It likes to attack from above, a maneuver that
is difficult to defend against.

Although its body is small, its proficient
fighting skills enable it to keep up with
big bruisers like Machamp and Hariyama.

abilities.name: limber
abilities.short_effect: Prevents paralysis.

abilities.name: unburden
abilities.short_effect: Doubles Speed upon using or losing a held item.

abilities.name: mold-breaker
abilities.short_effect: Bypasses targets' abilities if they could hinder or prevent a move.

name: dedenne
flavor_text:
A Dedenne’s whiskers pick up electrical waves
other Dedenne send out. These Pokémon share
locations of food or electricity with one another.

It sneaks into people’s homes and steals
electricity from their outlets. When your electric
bill seems off, it’s the handiwork of this rascal.

Since Dedenne can’t generate much electricity on
its own, it steals electricity from outlets or other
electric Pokémon.

Its whiskers serve as antennas. By sending and
receiving electrical waves, it can communicate
with others over vast distances.

Its upper whiskers are sensors that survey its
surroundings. Its lower whiskers are organs
that shoot electricity.

It uses its tail to absorb electricity from
power plants or from outlets in houses,
and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.

abilities.name: cheek-pouch
abilities.short_effect: Restores HP upon eating a Berry, in addition to the Berry's effect.

abilities.name: pickup
abilities.short_effect: Picks up other Pokémon's used and Flung held items.  May also pick up an item after battle.

abilities.name: plus
abilities.short_effect: Increases Special Attack to 1.5× when a friendly Pokémon has plus or minus.

name: carbink
flavor_text:
To keep the jewels on their bodies free of
tarnish, packs of Carbink use their soft manes
to polish one another’s jewels.

Born from the high temperatures and pressures
deep underground, it defends itself by firing
beams from the jewel part of its body.

Although this Pokémon is not especially rare,
its glittering, jewel-draped body draws
attention from people.

When beset by attackers, Carbink wipes them all
out by firing high-energy beams from the gems
embedded in its body.

Born from the temperatures and pressures
deep underground, it fires beams from the
stone in its head.

It’s said that somewhere in the world, there’s
a mineral vein housing a large pack of slumbering
Carbink. It’s also said that this pack has a queen.

Some say that deep beneath the surface of the
world, a pack of Carbink live with their queen in
a kingdom of jewels.

It has slept underground for hundreds of millions
of years since its birth. It’s occasionally found
during the excavation of caves.

abilities.name: clear-body
abilities.short_effect: Prevents stats from being lowered by other Pokémon.

abilities.name: sturdy
abilities.short_effect: Prevents being KOed from full HP, leaving 1 HP instead.  Protects against the one-hit KO moves regardless of HP.

name: goomy
flavor_text:
The weakest of all Dragon-type Pokémon,
it’s unable to breathe if its skin dries out,
so it sticks to shady places.

The weakest Dragon-type Pokémon,
it lives in damp, shady places, so its
body doesn’t dry out.

Its source of protection is its slimy, germ-laden
mucous membrane. Anyone who touches it
needs some thorough hand-washing.

Its body is mostly water. If it dries out, it will
die, so it’s always sitting with perfect stillness
in the shade.

It uses its horns to check out its surroundings.
They’re very sensitive, so if you grab them, it
will feel a strong shock and be unable to move.

Their horns are powerful sensors. As soon as
Goomy pick up any sign of enemies, they go into
hiding. This is how they’ve survived.

Goomy hides away in the shade of trees, where it's nice and
humid. If the slime coating its body dries out, the Pokémon
instantly becomes lethargic.

Because most of its body is water, it will dry up if
the weather becomes too arid. It’s considered
the weakest dragon Pokémon.

It’s covered in a slimy membrane that makes
any punches or kicks slide off it harmlessly.

abilities.name: sap-sipper
abilities.short_effect: Absorbs grass moves, raising Attack one stage.

abilities.name: hydration
abilities.short_effect: Cures any major status ailment after each turn during rain.

abilities.name: gooey
abilities.short_effect: Lowers attacking Pokémon's Speed by one stage on contact.

evolution_chain_details: goomy to sliggoo: level-up at level 40
sliggoo to goodra: level-up at level 50 while raining

name: sliggoo
flavor_text:
A creature given to melancholy. I suspect its metallic shell
developed as a result of the mucus on its skin reacting with
the iron in Hisui's water.

Its entire body is covered with gooey mucus
that can dissolve anything. Be sure to put
gloves on if you’re going to touch it.

It has trouble drawing a line between friends
and food. It will calmly try to melt and eat even
those it gets along well with.

Its four horns are a high-performance radar system.
It uses them to sense sounds and smells,
rather than using ears or a nose.

This Pokémon’s mucous can dissolve anything.
Toothless, it sprays mucous on its prey. Once
they’re nicely dissolved, it slurps them up.

The lump on its back contains its tiny brain.
It thinks only of food and escaping its enemies.

It crawls along sluggishly. The swirly protrusion
on its back is filled with its brain and
other organs.

Although this Pokémon isn’t very strong, its body
is coated in a caustic slime that can melt through
anything, so predators steer clear of it.

It drives away opponents by excreting a
sticky liquid that can dissolve anything.
Its eyes devolved, so it can’t see anything.

abilities.name: sap-sipper
abilities.short_effect: Absorbs grass moves, raising Attack one stage.

abilities.name: hydration
abilities.short_effect: Cures any major status ailment after each turn during rain.

abilities.name: gooey
abilities.short_effect: Lowers attacking Pokémon's Speed by one stage on contact.

evolution_chain_details: goomy to sliggoo: level-up at level 40
sliggoo to goodra: level-up at level 50 while raining

name: goodra
flavor_text:
This very friendly Dragon-type Pokémon
will hug its beloved Trainer, leaving
that Trainer covered in sticky slime.

Able to freely control the hardness of its metallic shell.
It loathes solitude and is extremely clingy—it will fume and
run riot if those dearest to it ever leave its side.

It gets picked on because it’s meek. But then,
whoever teased it gets to feel the full force of
its horns and a good swatting from its thick tail.

Sometimes it misunderstands instructions and
appears dazed or bewildered. Many Trainers
don’t mind, finding this behavior to be adorable.

It attacks with retractable horns.
It throws a punch that’s the equivalent
of the force of a hundred pro boxers.

An amazingly friendly Pokémon, but if left to
itself, loneliness overcomes it, and it oozes
gooey tears.

Underneath its slimy skin is a thick layer of fat,
and the combination of the two makes enemies’
attacks slide right off.

It’s very friendly toward people. If you grow
close to it, Goodra will hug you with its sticky,
slime-covered body. Don’t get mad.

Its form of offense is forcefully stretching out its
horns. The strikes land 100 times harder than any
blow from a heavyweight boxer.

abilities.name: sap-sipper
abilities.short_effect: Absorbs grass moves, raising Attack one stage.

abilities.name: hydration
abilities.short_effect: Cures any major status ailment after each turn during rain.

abilities.name: gooey

name: klefki
flavor_text:
Although it’s unclear why it collects keys, giving
it a key makes Klefki very happy. However, it
apparently only likes master keys.

This Pokémon is constantly collecting keys.
Entrust a Klefki with important keys, and the
Pokémon will protect them no matter what.

This even-tempered Pokémon has a habit of
collecting keys. It will sneak into people’s homes
to steal their keys.

Long ago it lived in mines, but once the minerals
that make up its diet became scarcer, Klefki
began appearing in human settlements.

Klefki sucks in metal ions with the horn topping
its head. It seems this Pokémon loves keys so
much that its head needed to look like one, too.

It inserts its horn into chinks in metal, absorbing
metal ions. For some reason, it collects keys.

It never lets go of a key that it likes,
so people give it the keys to vaults and
safes as a way to prevent crime.

These key collectors threaten any attackers
by fiercely jingling their keys at them.

abilities.name: prankster
abilities.short_effect: Raises non-damaging moves' priority by one stage.

abilities.name: magician
abilities.short_effect: Steals the target's held item when the bearer uses a damaging move.

name: phantump
flavor_text:
These Pokémon are created when
spirits possess rotten tree stumps.
They prefer to live in abandoned forests.

According to old tales, these Pokémon are
stumps possessed by the spirits of
children who died while lost in the forest.

An unknown spirit came to lodge in a tree
stump, creating this Pokémon. A cure-all can be
made from an infusion of its green leaves.

According to legend, medicine to cure any illness
can be made by plucking the green leaves on its
head, brewing them, and boiling down the liquid.

These Pokémon are stumps possessed by the
spirits of children who died in the forest.
Their cries sound like eerie screams.

By imitating the voice of a child, it causes
people to get hopelessly lost deep in the forest.
It’s trying to make friends with them.

After a lost child perished in the forest, their
spirit possessed a tree stump, causing the spirit’s
rebirth as this Pokémon.

With a voice like a human child’s, it cries out to
lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost
among the trees.

abilities.name: natural-cure
abilities.short_effect: Cures any major status ailment upon switching out.

abilities.name: frisk
abilities.short_effect: Reveals an opponent's held item upon entering battle.

abilities.name: harvest
abilities.short_effect: Has a 50% chance of restoring a used Berry after each turn if the Pokémon has held no items in the meantime.

evolution_chain_details: phantump to trevenant: trade

name: trevenant
flavor_text:
Small roots that extend from the tips of this
Pokémon’s feet can tie into the trees of the
forest and give Trevenant control over them.

Through its roots, it exerts control over other
trees. A deadly curse falls upon anyone cutting
down trees in forests where Trevenant dwell.

People fear it due to a belief that it devours any
who try to cut down trees in its forest, but to the
Pokémon it shares its woods with, it’s kind.

It can control trees at will. It will trap people
who harm the forest, so they can never leave.

Using its roots as a nervous system,
it controls the trees in the forest.
It’s kind to the Pokémon that reside in its body.

It’s feared as a ghost of the forest.
Lumberjacks bring along Fire types, which
Trevenant hates, when they enter the forest.

This Pokémon controls trees via roots
stretching from its feet, and it will attack
anyone that dares to ravage the forest.

This Pokémon is said to devour anyone daring to
ravage the forest. To the creatures dwelling in
the forest, it offers great kindness.

abilities.short_effect: Cures any major status ailment upon switching out.

name: pumpkaboo-average
flavor_text:
The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit
trapped in this world. As the sun sets,
it becomes restless and active.

The light that streams out from the holes in the
pumpkin can hypnotize and control the people
and Pokémon that see it.

It is said to carry wandering spirits
to the place where they belong
so they can move on.

Spirits that wander this world are placed into
Pumpkaboo’s body. They’re then moved on to
the afterlife.

abilities.name: pickup
abilities.short_effect: Picks up other Pokémon's used and Flung held items.  May also pick up an item after battle.

name: gourgeist-average
flavor_text:
In the darkness of a new-moon night, Gourgeist
will come knocking. Whoever answers the door
will be swept off to the afterlife.

Eerie cries emanate from its body in the dead of
night. The sounds are said to be the wails of
spirits who are suffering in the afterlife.

Singing in eerie voices, they wander
town streets on the night of the new moon.
Anyone who hears their song is cursed.

It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms.
It sings joyfully as it observes the
suffering of its prey.

abilities.name: pickup
abilities.short_effect: Picks up other Pokémon's used and Flung held items.  May also pick up an item after battle.

abilities.short_effect: Prevents sleep.

name: bergmite
flavor_text:
They chill the air around them to −150 degrees
Fahrenheit, freezing the water in the air into ice
that they use as armor.

This Pokémon lives in areas of frigid cold.
It secures itself to the back of an Avalugg
by freezing its feet in place.

Lives on mountains blanketed in perennial snow. It freezes water
vapor in the air to make the ice helmet that it dons for defense.

Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they
freeze opponents solid. They live in herds
above the snow line on mountains.

It blocks opponents’ attacks with the
ice that shields its body. It uses cold air
to repair any cracks with new ice.

abilities.name: own-tempo
abilities.short_effect: Prevents confusion.

abilities.name: ice-body
abilities.short_effect: Heals for 1/16 max HP after each turn during hail.  Protects against hail damage.

abilities.name: sturdy
abilities.short_effect: Prevents being KOed from full HP, leaving 1 HP instead.  Protects against the one-hit KO moves regardless of HP.

evolution_chain_details: bergmite to avalugg: level-up at level 37

name: avalugg
flavor_text:
The armor of ice covering its lower jaw puts steel to shame and
can shatter rocks with ease. This Pokémon barrels along steep
mountain paths, cleaving through the deep snow.

Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel.
Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that
stands in its way.

As Avalugg moves about during the day,
the cracks in its body deepen. The Pokémon’s
body returns to a pristine state overnight.

At high latitudes, this Pokémon can be found
with clusters of Bergmite on its back as it swims
among the icebergs.

The way several Bergmite huddle
on its back makes it look like
an aircraft carrier made of ice.

abilities.name: own-tempo

name: noibat
flavor_text:
Even a robust wrestler will become
dizzy and unable to stand when exposed
to its 200,000-hertz ultrasonic waves.

Fruits are its favorite foods. This gourmet
carefully picks out just the ripe ones using
its sonar.

After nightfall, they emerge from the caves they
nest in during the day. Using their ultrasonic
waves, they go on the hunt for ripened fruit.

No wavelength of sound is beyond Noibat’s
ability to produce. The ultrasonic waves it
generates can overcome much larger Pokémon.

It flies around in search of fruit to eat. It uses
ultrasonic waves to detect which fruits are ripe.

They live in pitch-black caves. Their enormous ears
can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.

abilities.name: frisk
abilities.short_effect: Reveals an opponent's held item upon entering battle.

abilities.name: infiltrator
abilities.short_effect: Bypasses light screen, reflect, and safeguard.

name: noivern
flavor_text:
This hot-blooded Pokémon attacks anything it
sees with ultrasonic waves that can
crush boulders.

Flying through the darkness, it weakens enemies
with ultrasonic waves that could crush stone.
Its fangs finish the fight.

Aggressive and cruel, this Pokémon will ruthlessly
torment enemies that are helpless in the dark.

The ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears
can reduce a large boulder to pebbles.
It swoops out of the dark to attack.

Although it has a violent disposition, if you give
it a nice ripe fruit that it loves, Noivern will
suddenly become tame.

They fly around on moonless nights
and attack careless prey. Nothing can
beat them in a battle in the dark.

name: xerneas
flavor_text:
When the horns on its head shine
in seven colors, it is said to be
sharing everlasting life.

Legends say it can share eternal life.
It slept for a thousand years in the form
of a tree before its revival.

abilities.name: fairy-aura
abilities.short_effect: Strengthens fairy moves to 1.33× their power for all friendly and opposing Pokémon.

name: yveltal
flavor_text:
When its life comes to an end, it absorbs
the life energy of every living thing
and turns into a cocoon once more.

When this legendary Pokémon’s wings and
tail feathers spread wide and glow red,
it absorbs the life force of living creatures.

abilities.name: dark-aura
abilities.short_effect: Strengthens dark moves to 1.33× their power for all friendly and opposing Pokémon.

name: zygarde-50
flavor_text:
This is Zygarde’s form when about half of its
pieces have been assembled. It plays the role of
monitoring the ecosystem.

It’s thought to be monitoring the ecosystem.
There are rumors that even greater power lies
hidden within it.

It’s hypothesized that it’s monitoring
those who destroy the ecosystem
from deep in the cave where it lives.

Some say it can change to an even more
powerful form when battling those who threaten
the ecosystem.

When the Kalos region’s ecosystem falls into
disarray, it appears and reveals its secret power.

This is Zygarde’s form when it has gathered
50% of its cells. It wipes out all those who
oppose it, showing not a shred of mercy.

abilities.name: aura-break
abilities.short_effect: Makes dark aura and fairy aura weaken moves of their respective types.

name: diancie
flavor_text:
A sudden transformation of Carbink,
its pink, glimmering body is said to be
the loveliest sight in the whole world.

It can instantly create many diamonds
by compressing the carbon in the air
between its hands.

abilities.name: clear-body
abilities.short_effect: Prevents stats from being lowered by other Pokémon.

name: hoopa
flavor_text:
It is said to be able to seize anything it desires
with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power
sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.

In its true form, it possess a huge amount of power.
Legends of its avarice tell how it once carried off
an entire castle to gain the treasure hidden within.

This troublemaker sends anything
and everything to faraway places
using its loop, which can warp space.

It gathers things it likes and passes them through
its loop to teleport them to a secret place.

abilities.name: magician
abilities.short_effect: Steals the target's held item when the bearer uses a damaging move.

name: volcanion
flavor_text:
It expels its internal steam from the
arms on its back. It has enough
power to blow away a mountain.

It lets out billows of steam and disappears into
the dense fog. It’s said to live in mountains
where humans do not tread.

abilities.name: water-absorb
abilities.short_effect: Absorbs water moves, healing for 1/4 max HP.

name: rowlet
flavor_text:
It sends its feathers, which are as sharp as
blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong,
so its kicks are also formidable.

Flies noiselessly on delicate wings. It has mastered the art of
deftly launching dagger-sharp feathers from those same wings.

It feels relaxed in tight, dark places and has
been known to use its Trainer’s pocket or bag
as a nest.

This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to
store up energy during the day, while becoming
active at night.

At a distance, it launches its sharp feathers while
flying about. If the enemy gets too close, Rowlet
switches tactics and delivers vicious kicks.

During the day, it builds up energy via
photosynthesis. At night, it flies silently
through the sky, on the prowl for prey.

Silently it glides, drawing near its targets. Before
they even notice it, it begins to pelt them with
vicious kicks.

abilities.name: overgrow
abilities.short_effect: Strengthens grass moves to inflict 1.5× damage at 1/3 max HP or less.

abilities.name: long-reach
abilities.short_effect: This Pokémon's moves do not make contact.

evolution_chain_details: rowlet to dartrix: level-up at level 17
dartrix to decidueye: level-up at level 34

name: dartrix
flavor_text:
This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak.
If you don’t groom it diligently, it will stop
listening to you.

Supremely sensitive to the presence of others,
it can detect opponents standing behind it,
flinging its sharp feathers to take them out.

It throws one knifelike feather after another at its
enemies, and each one precisely strikes a weak
point. These feathers are known as blade quills.

Regularly basks in sunlight to gather power—presumably due to
the frigid climate. Nonetheless, the edges of the blade quills set
into its wings are keen as ever.

A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time
preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any
dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.

It never slacks when it comes to the task of
cleaning its feathers. Thorough preening keeps it
looking spiffy and its blade quills nice and sharp.

It throws sharp feathers called blade quills
at enemies or prey. It seldom misses.

abilities.name: overgrow
abilities.short_effect: Strengthens grass moves to inflict 1.5× damage at 1/3 max HP or less.

abilities.name: long-reach
abilities.short_effect: This Pokémon's moves do not make contact.

evolution_chain_details: rowlet to dartrix: level-up at level 17
dartrix to decidueye: level-up at level 34

name: decidueye
flavor_text:
It nocks its arrow quills and shoots them at
opponents. When it simply can’t afford to miss,
it tugs the vine on its head to improve its focus.

In a tenth of a second, it can nock and fire an
arrow quill, piercing an opponent’s weak point
before they notice what’s happening.

Although basically cool and cautious, when it’s
caught by surprise, it’s seized by panic.

Decidueye can nock and fire an arrow at an
enemy in a tenth of a second, so its battles are
decided in the blink of an eye.

The air stored inside the rachises of Decidueye's feathers
insulates the Pokémon against Hisui's extreme cold. This is
firm proof that evolution can be influenced by environment.

It fires arrow quills from its wings with such
precision, they can pierce a pebble at distances
over a hundred yards.

As if wielding a bow, it launches the arrow quills
hidden among the feathers of its wings.
Decidueye’s shots never miss.

abilities.name: overgrow
abilities.short_effect: Strengthens grass moves to inflict 1.5× damage at 1/3 max HP or less.

abilities.name: long-reach
abilities.short_effect: This Pokémon's moves do not make contact.

evolution_chain_details: rowlet to dartrix: level-up at level 17
dartrix to decidueye: level-up at level 34

name: litten
flavor_text:
It spends even the smallest amount of downtime
grooming its fur with its tongue. Loose fur gathers
in its stomach and serves as fuel for fiery moves.

It doesn’t allow its emotions to be easily seen.
Earning its trust takes time. It prefers solitude.

While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its
stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery
attacks, which change based on how it coughs.

Trying to pet Litten before it trusts you will
result in a nasty scratch from its sharp claws.
Be careful.

If you try too hard to get close to it, it won’t
open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving
it too much affection is still a no-no.

Its coat regrows twice a year. When the time
comes, Litten sets its own body on fire and
burns away the old fur.

abilities.name: blaze
abilities.short_effect: Strengthens fire moves to inflict 1.5× damage at 1/3 max HP or less.

abilities.name: intimidate
abilities.short_effect: Lowers opponents' Attack one stage upon entering battle.

torracat to incineroar: level-up at level 34

name: torracat
flavor_text:
At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings
brightly whenever this Pokémon spits fire.

When facing a powerful enemy, Torracat’s
fighting spirit gets pumped up, and its fire bell
blazes hotter.

When its mane is standing on end, you can tell
it’s feeling good. When it isn’t feeling well, its fur
will lie down flat.

It boasts powerful front legs. With a single
punch, it can bend an iron bar right over.

It can act spoiled if it grows close to its Trainer.
A powerful Pokémon, its sharp claws can leave
its Trainer’s whole body covered in scratches.

In the midst of battle, the fire pouch on
Torracat’s neck rings like a bell and produces
stronger flames than usual.

abilities.name: blaze
abilities.short_effect: Strengthens fire moves to inflict 1.5× damage at 1/3 max HP or less.

abilities.short_effect: Lowers opponents' Attack one stage upon entering battle.

torracat to incineroar: level-up at level 34

name: incineroar
flavor_text:
When its fighting spirit is set alight, the flames
around its waist become especially intense.

It excels at violent, no-holds-barred battles.
The temperature of the flames that issue from its
navel exceeds 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

After hurling ferocious punches and flinging
furious kicks, it finishes opponents off by
spewing fire from around its navel.

This Pokémon has a violent, selfish disposition.
If it’s not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its
Trainer’s orders with complete nonchalance.

Although it’s rough mannered and egotistical, it
finds beating down unworthy opponents boring.
It gets motivated for stronger opponents.

Incineroar’s rough and aggressive behavior is its
most notable trait, but the way it helps out small
Pokémon shows that it has a kind side as well.

name: popplio
flavor_text:
This Pokémon can control water bubbles. It
practices diligently so it can learn to make
big bubbles.

The balloons it inflates with its nose grow
larger and larger as it practices day by day.

Popplio gets on top of its bouncy water balloons
to jump higher. It’s quite the acrobatic fighter!

It creates special bouncy balloons to send at its
opponents. When the balloons pop, the sheer
force of their bursting is what deals damage.

If Popplio want to create big, powerful balloons,
they must be persistent. It takes daily practice for
these Pokémon to develop their skills.

This Pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose,
blowing balloons to smash into its foes.
It’s famous for being a hard worker.

abilities.name: torrent
abilities.short_effect: Strengthens water moves to inflict 1.5× damage at 1/3 max HP or less.

abilities.name: liquid-voice
abilities.short_effect: Sound-based moves become Water-type.

evolution_chain_details: popplio to brionne: level-up at level 17
brionne to primarina: level-up at level 34

name: brionne
flavor_text:
It attacks by smacking its enemies with the
exploding water balloons that it creates.

A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water
balloons as it dances, and briskly bombards
its enemies.

As if dancing, it artfully dodges the attacks of its
enemies. All the while, it’s busy forming a bunch
of balloons to overwhelm its foes.

It cares deeply for its companions. When its
Trainer is feeling down, it performs a cheery
dance to try and help.

It gets excited when it sees a dance it doesn’t
know. This hard worker practices diligently until
it can learn that dance.

On nights when the sea is calm, Brionne dance
with one another to the singing of the Primarina
that’s leading them.

abilities.name: torrent
abilities.short_effect: Strengthens water moves to inflict 1.5× damage at 1/3 max HP or less.

abilities.name: liquid-voice
abilities.short_effect: Sound-based moves become Water-type.

evolution_chain_details: popplio to brionne: level-up at level 17
brionne to primarina: level-up at level 34

name: primarina
flavor_text:
For Primarina, every battle’s a stage. Its singing
and the dancing of its balloons will mesmerize
the audience.

With its mouth, it makes sonic waves that sound
like beautiful singing. It uses the sonic waves to
control its water balloons.

To Primarina, every battle is a stage. It takes
down its prey with beautiful singing
and dancing.

Its singing voice is its chief weapon in battle.
This Pokémon’s Trainer must prioritize the daily
maintenance of its throat at all costs.

It controls its water balloons with song. The
melody is learned from others of its kind and is
passed down from one generation to the next.

Also known as a songstress, it has a fantastical
look on moonlit nights when it leads its colony
in song.

abilities.name: torrent
abilities.short_effect: Strengthens water moves to inflict 1.5× damage at 1/3 max HP or less.

abilities.name: liquid-voice
abilities.short_effect: Sound-based moves become Water-type.

evolution_chain_details: popplio to brionne: level-up at level 17
brionne to primarina: level-up at level 34

name: pikipek
flavor_text:
It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are
heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times
per second!

This Pokémon feeds on berries, whose leftover
seeds become the ammunition for the attacks it
fires off from its mouth.

It can peck at a rate of 16 times a second to
drill holes in trees. It uses the holes for food
storage and for nesting.

It pecks at trees with its hard beak. You can
get some idea of its mood or condition from the
rhythm of its pecking.

abilities.short_effect: Prevents accuracy from being lowered.

abilities.name: skill-link
abilities.short_effect: Extends two-to-five-hit moves and triple kick to their full length every time.

abilities.short_effect: Picks up other Pokémon's used and Flung held items.  May also pick up an item after battle.

trumbeak to toucannon: level-up at level 28

name: trumbeak
flavor_text:
By bending its beak, it can produce a variety of
calls and brand itself a noisy nuisance for
its neighbors.

It eats berries and stores their seeds in its
beak. When it encounters enemies or prey,
it fires off all the seeds in a burst.

It can bend the tip of its beak to produce over
a hundred different cries at will.

From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries
it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise
to new plants.

abilities.name: keen-eye
abilities.short_effect: Prevents accuracy from being lowered.

abilities.name: skill-link
abilities.short_effect: Extends two-to-five-hit moves and triple kick to their full length every time.

abilities.name: pickup
abilities.short_effect: Picks up other Pokémon's used and Flung held items.  May also pick up an item after battle.

trumbeak to toucannon: level-up at level 28

name: toucannon
flavor_text:
They smack beaks with others of their kind to
communicate. The strength and number of hits
tell each other how they feel.

When it battles, its beak heats up. The
temperature can easily exceed 212 degrees
Fahrenheit, causing severe burns when it hits.

Known for forming harmonious couples, this
Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a
good luck charm.

Within its beak, its internal gas ignites,
explosively launching seeds with enough power
to pulverize boulders.

abilities.name: keen-eye
abilities.short_effect: Prevents accuracy from being lowered.

abilities.name: skill-link
abilities.short_effect: Extends two-to-five-hit moves and triple kick to their full length every time.
